medical_history.chief_complaint: Primary ovarian insufficiency (POI) with primary amenorrhea, growth retardation, and multiple pilomatricomas.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented at age 14 with intra-uterine and post-natal growth retardation, multiple pilomatricomas diagnosed at age 13, and primary amenorrhea. Hormonal assays revealed high FSH and LH levels and low estradiol. GH therapy was initiated at age 14 due to persistent short stature after intrauterine growth retardation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was born at term with intrauterine growth retardation, had hypotrophy in early years, and underwent adenoidectomy and ear tube insertion at age 7. She was treated with growth hormone therapy from ages 14 to 18.
medical_history.family_history: The mother has a history of primary ovarian insufficiency diagnosed at age 39, and both the mother and the patient carry the MCM8 mutation. The mother also has a history of hypothyroidism and Behcet disease.
